description: The Andes Resilientes initiative in Ecuador aims to enhance climate resilience and technical services for peasant family farming. Implemented by a consortium of the Avina Foundation and Betas, the project advocates for supportive public policies across key ministries. By fostering collaboration among stakeholders, it seeks to create sustainable agricultural practices, improve food security, and ensure farmers have access to essential resources and market opportunities, ultimately prioritizing their needs in the face of climate change.
name: Andes Resilientes
